definition: to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.chinese: 那些登山家遭遇許多困難。

sentences.english: But some mountaineers do not give up.
sentences.chinese: 但是一些登山家並沒有放棄。

sentences.english: The committee is comprised of well-known mountaineers.
sentences.chinese: 委員會由知名的登山家組成。

definition: Sven Hedin (1865-1952), famous Swedish adventurer and archaeologist, whose 1894-1900 Central Asian expeditions uncovered Kroraina or Loulan 樓蘭|楼兰
Alfred Wegener (1880-1930), German meteorologist and geophysicist, the originator of the theory of continental drift
Agnes Smedley (1892-1950), US journalist who reported on China, esp. the communist side
pinyin: Ai4 ge2 ni2 si1 · Shi3 mo4 te4 lai2
